title: How to Make Plain Greek Yogurt Taste Better

steps.headline: Scoop out some yogurt into a bowl with a spoon.
Squeeze some syrup on top.
steps.description: It can be any type of syrup - blueberry, strawberry or even chocolate! You can also do this with honey. Depending on how sweet you want your snack to be, add more or less of it. The more you add, the sweeter it will be. Most people like to add around two tablespoons. The amount you add also depends on the amount of yogurt you put into your bowl. A larger portion of yogurt needs a larger portion of syrup. There should be less syrup than yogurt. You can always add more than one type of syrup on top.

steps.headline: Mix well.
steps.description: If you don't combine it all together, you'll just be eating the syrup and yogurt separately! However, avoid mixing too vigorously as this may ruin the yogurt.

steps.headline: Scoop some yogurt into a bowl with a spoon.
Sprinkle either some nuts or granola on top, or both!
steps.description: This gives your snack a little bit of crunch to it! Don't add too much or too little - it depends on the amount of yogurt you added.

steps.headline: Mix well.
steps.description: The nuts/granola should be evenly spread out when you're done.

steps.headline: Scoop some yogurt into a bowl with a spoon.
Chop up some fruit.
steps.description: You can use any fruit you want, but berries such as blueberries, raspberries and strawberries usually work best in this case. Keep in mind that small fruits like blueberries and raspberries don't need to be chopped up.

steps.headline: Gather all the fruit and dunk it into the yogurt.
steps.description: If there is a lot of fruit, don't put it in all at once, as you will most likely drop some.

steps.headline: With a spoon, scoop some yogurt into a small bowl/container.
Open a pack of nachos/corn chips/Doritos.
steps.description: Put the contents into a separate bowl.

steps.headline: Take a chip and dip it into the yogurt.

text: Adding Syrups Scoop out some yogurt into a bowl with a spoon.  Squeeze some syrup on top. It can be any type of syrup - blueberry, strawberry or even chocolate! You can also do this with honey. Depending on how sweet you want your snack to be, add more or less of it. The more you add, the sweeter it will be. Most people like to add around two tablespoons. The amount you add also depends on the amount of yogurt you put into your bowl. A larger portion of yogurt needs a larger portion of syrup. There should be less syrup than yogurt. You can always add more than one type of syrup on top. Mix well. If you don't combine it all together, you'll just be eating the syrup and yogurt separately! However, avoid mixing too vigorously as this may ruin the yogurt. Enjoy!  Adding Nuts\/Granola Scoop some yogurt into a bowl with a spoon.  Sprinkle either some nuts or granola on top, or both! This gives your snack a little bit of crunch to it! Don't add too much or too little - it depends on the amount of yogurt you added. Mix well. The nuts/granola should be evenly spread out when you're done. Enjoy!  Adding Fresh Fruits Scoop some yogurt into a bowl with a spoon. Set this aside for later. Chop up some fruit. You can use any fruit you want, but berries such as blueberries, raspberries and strawberries usually work best in this case. Keep in mind that small fruits like blueberries and raspberries don't need to be chopped up. Gather all the fruit and dunk it into the yogurt. If there is a lot of fruit, don't put it in all at once, as you will most likely drop some. Mix well.  Enjoy!  Using it as a Dip With a spoon, scoop some yogurt into a small bowl/container.  Open a pack of nachos/corn chips/Doritos. Put the contents into a separate bowl. Take a chip and dip it into the yogurt.  Enjoy!
